column4: hey I'm back, I rebooted with the external USB hdd connected and it didn't work
this is the only usb hdd i have
should I do that?
well I don't know what's the sd# number of that disk
how can I know that?
I have 2 internal IDE HDD
and the external usb hdd
the dmesg | grep sdb shows info for the internal HDD
sudo fdisk -l from a terminal should tell you which drive you need
wols is on the right track then, your machine isn't recognizing its presence...
does the drive work on other machines and if so, what OS
wols: similar to the error i got on my external when the ide to usb controller failed... put the drive in a new case and its fine.
wols: worked intermittently under XP/Vista
unplug your drive, try this from a terminal "sudo modprobe -r ehci_hcd" then plug your drive in again... repost you dmesg output
its a bug... see here - https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/211760
will this be permanent, or should i modprobe eveytime I wanna use the HDD?
you could blacklist the module in /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist but i don't know how that will affect other drives you may use
are you fully up to date with your 8.04 patches?
have you (gasp!) enabled proposed-updates in your software sources?
or backports
*warning* enabling these will expose you to software that is not fully regression tested (proposed)
